channel.title: Desert Treasure ---- Pyramid
channel.description: The pyramid is so damn impossible im almost there and then i fall.. jagex does not know how to make an enjoyable game..

item.title: Desert Treasure ---- Pyramid
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“the fu superior, post:3, topic:184397”][quote author=pacmanpwns link=topic=246070.msg2074419#msg2074419 date=1203890001]
Cannon makes it much easier, and also if you have friends to block monsters. The guilds way over do it. Its not that hard, I did it at lvl 90 with no cannon and basic supplys with little trouble.

Post your cb stats and ill tell you roughly how hard it’ll be
[/quote]

Guilds way over do it? Who mixes up guild and guide?[/quote]

Obviously he does.

[quote=“Frell, post:13, topic:184397”]ok i got the blood, smoke, and shadow diamond, im about to do ice, but one problem, no one sells super restores in ge

Jagex is fucking crazy i just wasted a whole bunch of time trying to get the diamonds and the fucking pyramid is impossible.[/quote]

If you cannot stand the pyramid in desert treasure, NEVER do mourning’s end part 2. You won’t bear the first ten minutes of it.

item.title: Desert Treasure ---- Pyramid
item.dc:creator: @exe626 exe626
item.description:
@exe626 wrote:

The safe spot seems to have been removed. I guess you’re going to have to use the monsters around to keep him from hitting you. And yes, ranged his his 2nd form hard, because he doesn’t have armor anymore. If you took about 50 rune arrows and a magic bow you’ll do fine against that. A good fire or earth spell to easily defeat his 1st form.

The trolls are easy depending on how you approach them. The easiest choice would be a cannon, but that’s a bit pricey and dangerous to lay down. You could stock up on plenty of food and lots of super restores and just fight it out, but that might take 2 trips.

Kamil’s magic is pussy shit, with mystic on you’re pretty much using magic protection prayer. His melee however is another story. He can hit 30s, and 20 on average. Your best bet would be to use melee protection prayer and wear mystic.

Read full topic

item.title: Desert Treasure ---- Pyramid
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“exe626, post:8, topic:184397”][quote author=exe626 link=topic=238056.msg2023797#msg2023797 date=1201767635]
Damis is far from the hardest. He’s one of the easiest, tbh. Melee protect > mage. After his first form is dead, get to the safe spot and range(because he has no armor now. early in the fight he does(metal armor: weakness to mage, no armor: weakness to range).
Full monk robes(or better), a GOOD helmet(archer or farseer is good if you’re afraid to loose an expensive one), addy(or better) arrows, 65+ ranged, w/e level it is for earth blast is good enough.

Dessous, the ‘vampire guy’, is possibly the hardest next to Kamil(both evenly powerful and deadly to the wrong fighting type). Your best bet would be to protect from melee, take 4-6 prayer potions and the rest food and of course, a quick tele to gtfo when you mess up. I used range on several accounts, it seems to be most effective(even over Crumble Undead, since it splashes a lot due to Dessous’s mage ability and no armor). It will work, those who are mage pures will need it as a recommendation, but if you got ranged, go with it.

Kamil, uses a powerful barrage and amazing melee. I recommend HIGHLY using a very good mage defensive armor, and melee prayer. I swear this is the smartest route, taking his melee hits head on is suicide. It can be done, but not easily.
Mystic armor, fire spell(Chaos recommended, since he drains skills), 8-12 super restore(Highly recommended), the rest being a good food, and a tele-tablet(I say tablet because it only takes 1 slot, and it doesn’t require a level to tele).

Fareed is a follower of Zamorak, he uses the spell. He has a FULL fire defense, and you need ice gloves(Heroes Quest?) to wield a melee weapon, which wont hit through his powerful melee defense. I recommend a good water spell, melee prayer, mage defensive armor, 4~ prayer potions, tele-tablet, and the rest food/runes.
[/quote][/quote]
Should i go with range on damis second form? is it really that effective? and where is this ‘safe spot’? Just owned him
And is killing the 5 ice trolls to get to kamil easy? My friends say kamils barrage hits 5s but his melee is way more effective =\

any tips?

Read full topic

item.title: Desert Treasure ---- Pyramid
item.dc:creator: @exe626 exe626
item.description:
@exe626 wrote:

[quote=“exe626, post:12, topic:177183”]Damis is far from the hardest. He’s one of the easiest, tbh. Melee protect > mage. After his first form is dead, get to the safe spot and range(because he has no armor now. early in the fight he does(metal armor: weakness to mage, no armor: weakness to range).
Full monk robes(or better), a GOOD helmet(archer or farseer is good if you’re afraid to loose an expensive one), addy(or better) arrows, 65+ ranged, w/e level it is for earth blast is good enough.

Dessous, the ‘vampire guy’, is possibly the hardest next to Kamil(both evenly powerful and deadly to the wrong fighting type). Your best bet would be to protect from melee, take 4-6 prayer potions and the rest food and of course, a quick tele to gtfo when you mess up. I used range on several accounts, it seems to be most effective(even over Crumble Undead, since it splashes a lot due to Dessous’s mage ability and no armor). It will work, those who are mage pures will need it as a recommendation, but if you got ranged, go with it.

Kamil, uses a powerful barrage and amazing melee. I recommend HIGHLY using a very good mage defensive armor, and melee prayer. I swear this is the smartest route, taking his melee hits head on is suicide. It can be done, but not easily.
Mystic armor, fire spell(Chaos recommended, since he drains skills), 8-12 super restore(Highly recommended), the rest being a good food, and a tele-tablet(I say tablet because it only takes 1 slot, and it doesn’t require a level to tele).

Fareed is a follower of Zamorak, he uses the spell. He has a FULL fire defense, and you need ice gloves(Heroes Quest?) to wield a melee weapon, which wont hit through his powerful melee defense. I recommend a good water spell, melee prayer, mage defensive armor, 4~ prayer potions, tele-tablet, and the rest food/runes.[/quote]

item.title: Desert Treasure ---- Pyramid
item.dc:creator: @exe626 exe626
item.description:
@exe626 wrote:

It’s not as hard as it’s played out to be, and quest guides fail. Doing quest w/o guide = win. The only thing you need is experience fighting the different fighting style.
Melee/Ancients, Melee/Smite, Melee/Mage, Melee/Mage.
Kamil Damis Dessous Fareed

Read full topic
